page.title: 20HOPTON
page.content: {Hopton}is situated on the {river {Calder.}It is not a particularly attractive area, most of the houses are back to back terraces, built to house workers in the woollen mills of the area. Most of these are now closed the old mill buildings now house{new {service industries}e.g. car service firms, pallet makers and offices. The area has a neglected air, although there are signs of improvement. The river, which was{polluted}by industrial waste, is gradually becoming cleaner. Some of the houses are being modernised and the streets re-surfaced. The{school}has a nursery unit and is lOO years old.There is a {Reading and Language {Centre}which is used by teachers in the Kirklees Authority. The people would like better roads, pavements and street lighting.
